title: Animating Splash Art
body: I've seen a few of the speed drawings of various splash arts, but I've always wondered what the process is for animating these splash arts. So, could someone give a quick run down of what it's like to animate splash arts? :3

replies.body:
Well, there's this thing (And it's official):

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-bXtXtmRwdE
Oh thanks! I've never seen this before. :3

Hi, I'm one of the animators for these splashes!

The video Dwarven posted is a great example really; We mainly use Adobe After Effects to create tons of controllers and rigs to bring the character to life, and then add plenty of effects and animate everything else in the scene as well. That's really it in a nutshell (there are lots of special cases and things to consider while making one though!)

Anything else you are wondering about? 

Thanks!
Hi, just a reminder, your name isn't 'Red', so you might wanna take care of that or something. :P
I guess you can make some process with an animating tool called "puppet tool". I have tried making an animated splash for High Noon Jhin. it sucked, but showed off some promise. xD
